intro: Clerodendrum trifoliatum, commonly known as the three-leaved clerodendrum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, trifoliate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct three-lobed shape. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. The plant is also sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
